response_requirements.initial_response_description: Primary response timeline is 10 business days per ground truth verification (current as of 2025)
response_requirements.final_response_notes: 20 business days for personnel matters, criminal investigative information, or commercial purpose requests. 15 business days for general requests with notice if delayed.
response_requirements.extension_notes: If records not provided within 15 business days, must provide estimated completion date and reasons for delay
response_requirements.immediate_access: Records available for inspection during office hours
acknowledgment_requirements: Statement that request will be processed according to law
Name and contact info of responsible person/office

fee_structure.search_fee: No separate search fee; only copying costs
fee_structure.search_fee_notes: Fees may not exceed amount necessary to reimburse actual costs to reproduce
fee_structure.copy_fee_notes: Per-page fee established by Director of Arizona Department of Administration
fee_structure.electronic_fee: Actual cost of producing electronic records
fee_structure.prepayment_notes: Custodian may require advance payment for copying and postage if requesting mailed copies

exemptions.description: Library records identifying persons who requested, used, or borrowed materials
Records received by legislators during sessions deemed confidential
Billing information identifying residential locations or revealing usage patterns
Records required by federal law, federal regulation, state statute, or court rules to be confidential
Records prohibited from disclosure by federal law

appeal_process.first_level_notes: Citizens may file complaints with Ombudsman who can investigate and make recommendations
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: Attorney fees may be available in some cases
appeal_process.criminal_penalties: Class 2 misdemeanor for unlawful refusal to allow examination or failure to comply with response requirements

requester_requirements.purpose_notes: No general purpose requirement, except for commercial purposes
requester_requirements.commercial_purpose_notes: Must provide statement of commercial purpose; Governor may prohibit disclosure for certain commercial purposes deemed misuse or abuse
requester_requirements.request_format_notes: May request examination, copies, or mailing of records
requester_requirements.specific_format: Must describe records with sufficient detail to locate them

agency_obligations.business_hours_notes: Records open to inspection during all office hours
agency_obligations.electronic_submission_notes: Written requests may be submitted; public bodies may maintain websites with records
agency_obligations.response_format_options: Must make reasonable efforts to provide records in requested format if they exist in that format
agency_obligations.redaction_requirements: Must provide non-confidential portions if part of record is exempt
agency_obligations.record_maintenance: All public bodies must maintain records reasonably necessary to provide knowledge of their activities
agency_obligations.indexing_requirement: Must maintain index of public records or different organizational system approved by State Library Director
agency_obligations.statutory_authority_statement: Must promptly furnish written statement of specific statutory authority for disclosure or nondisclosure if requested

oversight_body.name: Office of the Ombudsman-Citizens Aide
oversight_body.role: Investigates complaints and makes recommendations regarding public records denials
oversight_body.notes: No formal enforcement power; compliance through criminal penalties and civil remedies

official_resources.request_portal_notes: Individual agencies may maintain their own request systems

primary_sources: Arizona Revised Statutes Title 39, Sections 39-101 through 39-161
validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields verified from statutory text. Arizona has tiered response requirements: 5 days acknowledgment, 20 days for personnel/criminal/commercial requests, 15 days for general with notice if delayed. Ombudsman provides informal oversight. Criminal penalties for violations. Commercial purpose requests require disclosure and may be subject to Governor prohibition.
unique_characteristics: Acknowledgment must include unique ID and contact info
20 business days for personnel, criminal investigative, or commercial requests
Governor may prohibit certain commercial uses
Must provide estimated completion date if delayed beyond 15 days
